news.title: Ryan Tubridy repays €150,000 at centre of RTÉ payments scandal
news.summary: Irish broadcaster Ryan Tubridy has repaid RTÉ a sum of €150,000 he received as part of a controversial payment deal made in 2020.

news.title: Coroner rules death of Co Laois man (24) on New Zealand farm was preventable: ‘tragedy could have been averted’
news.summary: An Irish farm worker who died after he was electrocuted while working on a farm in New Zealand could have been saved by “simple, no-cost steps,” it has been revealed.

news.title: ‘This is on a different scale’ – fans rave about Dublin Horse Show as the Netherlands swoop for Aga Khan Trophy
news.summary: Day three of the 150th Dublin Horse Show was the busiest so far as a sellout crowd witnessed the Netherlands clinch the prestigious Aga Khan Challenge Trophy with an immaculate score of zero faults.

news.title: Ireland intends to pass trade ban with Israeli settlements amid pressure from US Congress
news.summary: Ireland intends to continue to advance with its legislation to ban the import of goods from illegal Israeli settlements.

news.title: Ger Brennan confirmed as new Dublin football manager
news.summary: Ger Brennan has been appointed as Dublin’s new senior football manager for the next three seasons.

news.title: Gardaí search army barracks as part of child sexual exploitation investigation
news.summary: Gardaí have carried out a search of a military barracks as part of a child sexual exploitation investigation.

news.title: Ballymaguire Foods approved to produce meals again weeks after more than 140 products were taken off shelves after listeria detection
news.summary: Ballymaguire Foods has received approval from the HSE to start production today once again after a “thorough” review into the possible presence of listeria at one production site.

news.title: A holy communion: How new vocations – and plenty of visitors – help to keep the doors of Kylemore Abbey open
news.summary: In a world of reality TV, we are all used to the tropes of on-screen “true-life” drama these days,  but it is unusual to see these played out in a community of Benedictine nuns.

news.title: Kneecap apologise to fans after Vienna concert cancelled due to ‘safety concerns’
news.summary: Belfast rap trio Kneecap have apologised to fans after their show in Vienna was cancelled “due to acute safety concerns”.

news.title: Tanya Sweeney: The ugly truth is Botox, fillers and perfect brows are now considered the ‘bare’ minimum
news.summary: ‘Make-up free’ can mean different things to different people. To me, it means looking in the mirror at pitiful eyebrows, pores you could store spuds in, stubby eyelashes and a decent whack of rosacea, which keeps me humble if nothing else.
